learning_obj.text: Gain a comprehensive understanding of how to develop a service with DMADV.
Utilize this information to efficiently develop a service.
Use the DMADV process to enhance a pre-existing service.
How DMADV can be used in a worthwhile development project.

characteristics.text: DMADV maps out a process into:

sub_bullets.text: Define - identify the purpose of the project/service, make achievable goals and set the schedule.
Measure - measure the factors needed to ensure quality, the characteristics customers need.
Analyze - investigate the potential issues or problems that the project may face or create.
Design - after considering the drawbacks, a process will be designed, or mapped out.
Verify - confirm that the design will serve all needs, including investors; plan to turn the prototype into a sustainable process.

characteristics.text: Aims to create a process to please customers, shareholders, and sustain long term success.

process.text: Decide on the purpose of the service or process, and make achievable goals, with a usable schedule for the creation of the process.
Collect data for the process to discover its potential flaws, and identify Critical-to-Quality (CTQ) characteristics.
Analyze the data to discover what causes the flaws.
Make prototypes for new models of the process to correct for its flaws, and iterate until improvements are reliable.
Implement the improvements into the process, and ensure that the process can work reliably long term.

benefits.text: Improves pre-existing processes, and can create new processes.
Can be used in different businesses, and since it includes testing and perfecting phases, is very reliable.
Is connected to Lean Six Sigma, which is a business-industry recognized method of organization.
Allows for comprehensive review and revision, which can ensure a high-quality project or process.

Can focus on Worthwhile Development, because it gives an opportunity to revise and perfect a process or project for its end users and business, providing opportunities to ensure ethicality and sustainability.

drawbacks.text: Can be confusing for new users, as the process involves revision and development phases.
Six Sigma (and DMADV as part of it) can be difficult for new users to adopt.

example.text: Define - Decide on the purpose of the good or process, and make a schedule. Example: design a pair of professional high heels that offer good arch support.
Measure - Collect data by having a group of testers wear the current design and report back on comfort and fit.
Analyze - Use the collected data to identify weak points (e.g., sides and front pinch the foot).
Design - Create and test prototypes (e.g., wider toe box and sides) and iterate with testers until acceptable.
Verify - Implement the improved design, secure investment, and scale to manufacturing while maintaining the adjusted parameters for comfort.

evaluation.text: Can you explain each of the five steps in DMADV?
Quickly explain DMADV for a process of your own (very general is fine).
What are CTQ characteristics? Define them carefully.
